CatDescriptText: Marlene Haleva, waitress, Oakdale and Patricia Grohoski, Oakdale were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 23, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you believe the people who vote only for the President every four years make the best citizens?"  Ms. Haleva's answer reads "No, you should vote in every election." Ms. Grohoski's answer reads: "No, you should vote every year.  Four years is too long to wait.  If you don't like who's in office, you can vote them out, but not by voting once every four years."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Marlene Haleva wearing dark coat with tab collar and metallic buttons, standing near Bud Saunders flower shop, Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Patricia Grohoski wearing dark plaid coat with round dark buttons, standing near Bud Saunders flower shop, Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
